title: Refining Code Coverage to Better Reflect Fuzzing Performance
data:
S Lipp - 2025
Fuzzing is a testing technique that executes the software with malformed inputs to 
uncover vulnerabilities. Traditional metrics like code coverage treat all code as 
equally important and can, therefore, lead to inaccurate fuzzing assessments. This 
thesis introduces a novel vulnerability-oriented metric that focuses on the covered, 
potentially vulnerable code to better reflect the efficiency and effectiveness of fuzzing.
